alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Maryland, including the following counties: Allegany and Garrett. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Frostburg... Bittinger... Grantsville... Friendsville... Accident... Eckhart Mines... Midland... Midlothian... Woodland... Jennings... Keysers Ridge... New Germany... Merrill... Piney Grove... Mineral Spring... McHenry... Selbysport... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
